attributes.action: Introduce Tax Rebates on Mortgage Repayments
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The complete amount that is paid by any individual as part of the mortgage repayment should be made tax free. Thus if you pay £200 as your mortgage repayment installment (i.e £2400 per year), the total income of that individual should be reduced by £2400 before tax is calculated for that person. This will help give a boost to the mortgage market.

Also any banking company which charges more than 3% over Bank of England Rate should be charges a special tax of 50% on their total income from mortgages. This is help bank pass on the rate changes to the people.

Following are examples of the rates charged by Banks within a single banking group where the Govt is a majority shareholder

Bank of Scotland - 4.84% Home Loan Rate
Scottish Widows - 3.99% Standard Variable Rate
Halifax - 3.5% Standard Variable Rate
Lloyds TSB - 2.5% Standard Variable Rate
C&G - 2.5% Standard Variable Rate

Thus there is a spread of almost 100% between each of them
